channel.title: I need help
channel.description: So after hours of looking, i canot find a way to lets say, when you login, make it save an account with the files to a .txt or .dat. please help me, i know the IO way to do it, but that just puts in text. please help

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“slavemaster, post:12, topic:410018”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=511287.msg3710297#msg3710297 date=1313298635]

Object I/O Streams

Those work really well, a problem can be that it will save/load literally all data as well. Can create issues with the socket information if they are at a new IP etc. Unless you fix this.
[/quote]

That’s why we have the transient modifier. ;)[/quote]
rep++

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

As Anthony stated just use Sqlite, considering it’s easy as fuck to set up and use.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Javerfire, post:9, topic:410018”][quote author=_s link=topic=511287.msg3710602#msg3710602 date=1313333826]
use a database you fat idiots
[/quote]
i assume you expect this comment to mean something? the solution has already been proposed and i suggest your further comments contain helpful suggestions and not ridiculous put downs. A database is too massive for an rsps project, there is no need.[/quote]
are you fucking retarded

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“slavemaster, post:12, topic:410018”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=511287.msg3710297#msg3710297 date=1313298635]

Object I/O Streams

Those work really well, a problem can be that it will save/load literally all data as well. Can create issues with the socket information if they are at a new IP etc. Unless you fix this.
[/quote]

That’s why we have the transient modifier. ;)[/quote]
Its an easy fix however you want to approach it. If you’re new to the object streams it can be confusing more than difficult.

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:

Object I/O Streams
[/quote]
Those work really well, a problem can be that it will save/load literally all data as well. Can create issues with the socket information if they are at a new IP etc. Unless you fix this.[/quote]

That’s why we have the transient modifier.

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:10, topic:410018”][quote author=Javerfire link=topic=511287.msg3710672#msg3710672 date=1313338861]

use a database you fat idiots

i assume you expect this comment to mean something? the solution has already been proposed and i suggest your further comments contain helpful suggestions and not ridiculous put downs. A database is too massive for an rsps project, there is no need.
[/quote]
Databases are specifically built for large scale projects. I just find it useless for using database for smaller projects (I consider rsps’s to be small in most cases).

My bad, read your post wrong :P.[/quote]

sqlite???

Read full topic

item.title: I need help
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Well now ive got two projects on my hand, does anyone know how to handle with player saving and rendering in an rsps, because im creating something from scratch and need to know any advice is welcome

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

T4_:

Object I/O Streams

Those work really well, a problem can be that it will save/load literally all data as well. Can create issues with the socket information if they are at a new IP etc. Unless you fix this.

item.title: I need help

item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

BufferedWriter is what I generally use. Should be able to find a few tutorials bout writing/reading Strings with the BufferedWriter and BufferedReader classes.
